intro: Lomariopsis hederacea, commonly known as the creeping wood sorrel, is a species of flowering plant in the family Violaceae. It is native to the eastern United States and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and along stream banks. It has a rhizomatous growth habit, allowing it to spread and form dense mats. The leaves are often hairy, and the flowers are borne in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
